Canvas Rendering¶

The members of this package make plots from histograms or other wrapped ROOT-objects. The ‘Renderers’ extend the functionality of wrappers for drawing. The ROOT-canvas is build with the CanvasBuilder class. The functionality of CanvasBuilder can be extended with decorators, see below.

Renderers for wrapper types¶

class cmstoolsac3b.rendering.Renderer(wrp)[source]¶

Baseclass for rendered wrappers.

class cmstoolsac3b.rendering.HistoRenderer(wrp)[source]¶

Bases: cmstoolsac3b.rendering.Renderer, cmstoolsac3b.wrappers.HistoWrapper

Extend HistoWrapper for drawing.

class cmstoolsac3b.rendering.StackRenderer(wrp)[source]¶

Bases: cmstoolsac3b.rendering.HistoRenderer, cmstoolsac3b.wrappers.StackWrapper

Extend StackWrapper for drawing.

Canvas Building¶

class cmstoolsac3b.rendering.CanvasBuilder(wrps, **kws)[source]¶

Create a TCanvas and plot wrapped ROOT-objects.

Use this class like so:

cb = CanvasBuilder(list_of_wrappers, **kws)
canvas_wrp = cb.build_canvas()
  • list_of_wrappers is can also be a list of renderers. If not, the renderers are created automaticly.
  • **kws can be empty. Accepted keywords are name= and title= and any keyword that is accepted by histotools.wrappers.CanvasWrapper.

When designing decorators, these instance data members can be of interest:

x_bounds Bounds of canvas area in x
y_bounds Bounds of canvas area in y
y_min_gr_zero smallest y greater zero (need in log plotting)
canvas Reference to the TCanvas instance
main_pad Reference to TPad instance
second_pad Reference to TPad instance or None
first_drawn TObject which is first drawed (for valid TAxis reference)
legend Reference to TLegend object.
configure()[source]¶

Called at first. Can be used to initialize decorators.

find_x_y_bounds()[source]¶

Scan ROOT-objects for x and y bounds.

make_empty_canvas()[source]¶

Instanciate self.canvas .

draw_full_plot()[source]¶

The renderers draw method is called.

do_final_cosmetics()[source]¶

Pimp the canvas!

run_procedure()[source]¶

This method calls all other methods, which fill and build the canvas.

build_canvas()[source]¶

With this method, the building procedure is started.

Returns:CanvasWrapper instance.

Decorators for CanvasBuilder¶

Decorators are the way to add content to canvases, like a legend, boxes, lines, text, etc.. See Decorator for details on the decorator implementation. Apply as below (e.g. with a ‘Legend’ and a ‘TextBox’ Decorator):

cb = CanvasBuilder(wrappers)
cb = Legend(cb, x1=0.2, x2=0.5)
cb = Textbox(cb, text="Some boxed Text")
canvas_wrp = cb.build_canvas()
class cmstoolsac3b.rendering.Legend(inner, dd='True', **kws)[source]¶

Bases: cmstoolsac3b.decorator.Decorator

Adds a legend to the main_pad.

Takes entries from self.main_pad.BuildLegend() . The box height is adjusted by the number of legend entries. No border or shadow are printed. See __init__ for keywords.

do_final_cosmetics()[source]¶

Only do_final_cosmetics is overwritten here.

If self.legend == None, this method will create a default legend and store it to self.legend
